title: 2025 NFL draft: Pros and cons for every first-round pick

title: Ex-RB Peterson faces DWI charge in Minnesota
content: Former NFL running back Adrian Peterson was arrested Friday morning in Minnesota and charged with fourth-degree driving while impaired, according to online records maintained by the Hennepin County sheriff.

title: Raiders GM honors son's preference, picks Jeanty
content: The Raiders selected Boise State running back Ashton Jeanty with the No. 6 pick in the NFL draft Thursday night.

title: Mistrial in Hockey Canada case; process restarts
content: A judge declared a mistrial in the sexual assault case involving five former members of Canada's world junior hockey team. The ruling means a new trial will be held, and jury selection for it began Friday.

title: Pistons, Knicks miffed by officiating in wild finish
content: Both clubs were unhappy after a pair of odd plays that were or weren't whistled in the closing seconds of New York's win in Detroit on Thursday night.

title: Steelers pass on QBs: 'We wanted' DT Harmon
content: The Steelers fielded several offers for the No. 21 pick, but said they never considered trading it away when they had the chance to take Oregon defensive tackle Derrick Harmon on Thursday night.

title: NWSL seeks to launch second division in 2026
content: The National Women's Soccer League has formally applied to the U.S. Soccer Federation to create a new Division II league.

title: Stanley Cup playoffs daily: Will the Canadiens, Devils, Oilers get on the board?
content: All three teams returned home down 0-2. Can they turn the tide? Plus, Thursday's highlights and Three Stars.

title: Slow start? Not this year! Francisco Lindor has Mets rolling
content: After stumbling out of the gate last season, the star shortstop and his team are lighting up Citi Field.

title: What the Jaxson Dart pick means for Brian Daboll, Joe Schoen
content: The 21-year-old Ole Miss product is positioned to be the Giants' QB of the future, but he might not play in 2025.

title: Vancouver blanks Messi's Miami in CCC first semi

title: Chelsea-bound Estêvão scores, vomits in Copa win
content: Palmeiras' Estêvão had an 18th birthday to remember, netting the club's second goal in a 3-2 Copa Libertadores win over Bolivar before dropping to the turf, vomiting and leaving the field on a stretcher as the high altitude of La Paz took its toll.

title: Burnley seek payment after pitch invasion
content: Burnley will see reparations from the fans who invaded the pitch after their promotion-clinching win over Sheffield United and damaged the LED boards at Turf Moor.

title: Slot insists Liverpool 'still have a job to do' in PL
content: Arne Slot has insisted Liverpool still have a job to do against Tottenham Hotspur this weekend, despite needing only one point to seal the Premier League title.

title: Szczesny on smoking: Don't follow my example
content: Barcelona goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny has told ESPN he has lost his battle with smoking and urged others not to follow his lead.

title: Sources: Brazil in talks again with Ancelotti's camp
content: Carlo Ancelotti is once again the front-runner for Brazil's vacant coaching job, sources told ESPN Brasil.

title: Ter Stegen back in Barça squad for Copa final
content: Marc-Andre ter Stegen has been included in Barcelona's squad for the Copa del Rey final against Real Madrid after recovering from a knee injury ahead of schedule.

title: Source: Bayern's Müller rejects Cincinnati offer
content: Bayern Munich midfielder/forward Thomas Müller has rejected a contract offer from FC Cincinnati, a source confirmed to ESPN.

content: Raphinha is struggling to agree a new contract with Barcelona as Saudi Pro League clubs watch on. Transfer Talk has the latest.

content: The hospital authorities began preparations to perform heart transplant after the institution received licence for the procedure from the Kerala State Organ and Tissue Transplant Organisation in December last year

content: Hundreds of fishermen have been migrating to Gujarat, Maharashtra, Tamil Nadu and other places in search of livelihood due to limited opportunities in Srikakulam district

content: The accused brought the woman from Hyderabad to Kurnool promising gold at a cheaper price and decamped with the money

content: The Ernakulam unit of the KGMOA has demanded action against the official in protest of his alleged arrogant attitude

content: Released in 2013, Kasturirangan report remains one of the most contested documents in Kerala’s environmental history, continuing to stir discussions about balancing ecological protection with the rights of local communities

content: The development comes to light during a high-level business interaction hosted by the Kalyana Karnataka Chamber of Commerce & Industry

title: Spices Board to promote climate-resilient cardamom varieties in Idukki
content: ICRI-10, developed by the Indian Cardamom Research Institute at Myladumpara, was developed after 10 years of research. It had successfully tackled the drought that gripped the area last year.

content: A five-member team led by station in-charge M.V. Stephen rushed to the scene after a goat somehow managed to sneak onto the sunshade of a second-floor apartment at Kalamassery

content: NIIST describes establishment of the facility as a “major step towards combating hidden hunger and enhancing nutritional security”

content: HRD Minister Lokesh recalls the former ISRO Chairman’s vision in shaping the National Education Policy-2020, while YSRCP chief Jagan Mohan Reddy says he has left an indelible mark on India’s space history

content: ‘Schemes like Startup India, Stand-Up India and the Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana played an instrumental role in generating employment’

content: The restoration project of Bamboo Club in Kodagu included creating an overhang of Mangalore tiles in the front of the building, and enabling ample sunlight to stream into the interiors

content: An initiative of Anusandhan National Research Foundation, it comes as a major boost to the university’s research capabilities

title: State to hold safety, destination audit of ecotourism spots
content: Safety audit will identify potential hazards and deficiencies in safety protocols, while destination audit will identify the strengths and deficiencies in  the ecotourism destinations

content: Campaign aims to raise awareness and encourage regular blood pressure checks to mitigate risks of brain stroke, heart attack and kidney failures; BP bus flagged off

title: President Murmu in Rome to attend Pope Francis' funeral
content: President Murmu is on a two-day visit to the Vatican City and will offer condolences on behalf of the government and people of India

content: Body of Arumukhan who was trampled to death by a wild elephant on Thursday was handed over to relatives after post mortem at Bathery Taluk hospital

title: Iconic Integrated Amaravati Government Complex with five towers to come up in 32 acres
content: The towers will house the General Administration Department, the Andhra Pradesh State Secretariat, and HoD offices; tenders have already been called for their construction in three packages

title: Action against Shine will be decided after ICC report, says film chamber
content: Kerala Film Chamber of Commerce says it will not be lenient in the fight against drug menace on film sets and those violating rules will feel the heat

title: Govt. will ask developers to forfeit illegal layouts on farmlands: Krishna Byre Gowda
content: Revenue Department will provide title deeds to one lakh families residing in tandas across the State on May 20 to coincide with two years of the Congress government coming to power

title: New measures to ensure professionalism and transparency in Nehru Trophy Boat Race
content: Last year’s Nehru Trophy Boat Race was marred by controversy over the racing teams disputing the final results

title: U.S. funding cuts likely to impact long-term research in malaria: Jane Carlton
content: Dr. Jane Carlton is a globally recognized leader in malaria genomics and director of the Johns Hopkins Malaria Research Institute. In an email interview, she details the impact of aid suspension and funding cuts on malaria control, discusses the newest breakthroughs in research and warns of climate change  potentially increasing malaria cases worldwide says that though India will not see any immediate adverse effect of the US funding cut to the global malaria programme it will, however, impact the national research, training and teaching of the next generation of malaria researchers

title: No scope for controversy over Vijnana Keralam post, says Isaac
content: A public interest litigation had questioned his appointment as advisor to the State government initiative

title: Tourists stranded in north Sikkim on their way back to Gangtok: Officials
content: Around 200 tourist vehicles had been stranded at Chungthang on Thursday and the occupants took shelter in a Gurdwara

title: ‘Thudarum’ movie review: Mohanlal in top form in a fine film, with minor flaws
content: ‘Thudarum’ returns to fans of the actor in all his myriad shades, from the playful to the emotional, in a role which is closer in spirit to the “Mohanlal of the past”

title: At the Bhitarkanika National Park, set sail and spot a crocodile
content: From Gupti in Odisha, we set sail on a luxury catamaran and spot saltwater crocodiles, spotted deer and a host of birds at the Bhitarkanika National Park, India’s second largest Mangrove ecosystem

title: Important that India stands united against terror: Rahul Gandhi in Srinagar
content: The Congress leader, who arrived in Srinagar Friday morning, visited the Army's 92 Base hospital at Badamibagh Cantonment to inquire about the injured

title: EPFO simplifies PF account transfer process on job change
content: EPFO has removed the requirement of approval of all transfer claims at the Destination Office by launching a revamped form 13 software functionality.

title: NEET-UG paper leak prime accused Sanjeev Mukhiya arrested
content: Mukhiya was also wanted in several other paper leak cases in Bihar and he was absconding for the past 11 months.

title: Supreme Court questions IAF over denial of family pension to stepmother of personnel; says mother is very wide term’
content: The Supreme Court to examine if a stepmother can be considered for family pension under the Indian Air Force rules; “it is not the biological mother alone who raises the child”

title: NHRC condemns Pahalgam attack, asks State to ensure necessary steps to fix accountability
content: It is expected that the State will take all the necessary steps to fix accountability; bring the perpetrators to justice and provide succour to the families of the victims in all possible manner, says NHRC in a statement

title: Free education for visually challenged girls in Mysuru
content: Ranga Rao Memorial School for Differently Abled has invited applications for admissions in the ensuing academic year

content: The meeting is expected to discuss the future course of action and how to implement the decision of keeping the treaty ‘in abeyance’, they said.

content: Ganesha Sharma Dravid, a Rig Vedic scholar, is set be inducted into the mutt at a function to be held in Kancheepuram on April 30

title: Amit Shah dials all CMs, asks them to ensure no Pakistani citizens stays in India beyond deadline
content: India on Thursday April 24, announced revoking all visas issued to Pakistani nationals from April 27 and advised Indian nationals residing in Pakistan to return home at the earliest.

title: What's at stake across the top leagues: Titles, cup finals, UCL, relegation
content: a roundup of what's at stake, and what could be decided, in the English Premier League , German Bundesliga , Spanish LaLiga , Italian Serie A and French Ligue 1 . most teams have played 33 games going into the weekend . the top five will qualify for the U.S. champions league .

title: Ward, Jeanty have best odds for offensive ROY
content: the Raiders take Boise State RB Ashton Jeanty with the sixth pick of the 2025 NFL draft . sportsbooks release their initial odds on the offensive and defensive sides of the ball . two-way superstar Travis Hunter ended up with the Jacksonville Jaguars following a blockbuster trade on Thursday night .

title: Eastern Conference playoffs: KAT and Brunson take over for Knicks
content: the 2025 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the Finals . the no. 5 seed Milwaukee Bucks will try to get back into their series against the Indiana Pacers .

title: 'All I needed was a chance': How Cam Ward went from zero-star recruit to No. 1 pick
content: Cam Ward was drafted by the Titans in the 2025 draft . he played his final college season at a school that's never had a player drafted to the NFL . his early collegiate days began in front of 6,000 people on game days .

title: Transfer portal's lure involves more than just a big payday for players
content: Clayton Powell-Lee has spent some sleep-deprived nights searching for an answer . if he stays at Georgia Tech for his final season of eligibility, he can build on his 53 tackles last season . the 21-year-old says he's worth more than his current payday .

title: 'We've been doing dirty work ...': Pakistan defence minister admits supporting terror groups
content: Pakistan's defence minister admitted to undertaking "dirty work" for the United States and the West for three decades, acknowledging it as a mistake that led to suffering. Following the Pahalgam attack, which resulted in 26 deaths, the government responded by suspending the Indus Waters Treaty, closing the Attari ICP, and reducing diplomatic staff.

title: Not a drop of water will go to Pak, roadmap prepared: Jal Shakti minister
content: Following a meeting with Home Minister Amit Shah, Union Jal Shakti Minister CR Paatil announced a detailed plan to prevent Indian river water from flowing into Pakistan. The government is considering short, medium, and long-term strategies, including immediate desilting of rivers.

title: Drama at Chepauk! Jadeja's bat fails umpire's gauge test - Watch
content: In an unusual incident during the IPL match between Chennai Super Kings and Sunrisers Hyderabad, Ravindra Jadeja's bat failed the umpire's inspection due to size regulations. This forced Jadeja to change his bat immediately after Sam Curran's dismissal. Sunrisers Hyderabad chose to bowl first after winning the toss, leading to strategic lineup changes for both teams.

title: Musk replies to JD Vance's family photos from Taj Mahal: One of the ...
content: US Vice President JD Vance, accompanied by his family, recently visited the Taj Mahal during a four-day trip to India. Vance shared photos on X, with Elon Musk commenting on the monument's beauty. The family's visit included a warm welcome from Uttar Pradesh's Chief Minister and stringent security measures along their route.

title: Unique record! Mohd Shami makes IPL history as first bowler to ...
content: Mohammed Shami etched his name in IPL record books by becoming the first bowler to claim a first-ball wicket for the fourth time, dismissing Shaik Rasheed in the SRH vs CSK match. Rasheed and Ayush Mhatre also made history as the second-youngest opening pair in IPL history, with a combined age of 38 years and 131 days.

title: ‘I’m doing the work’: Melinda Gates responds to Elon Musk, Bezos' ex-wife criticism
content: Melinda Gates addressed criticisms from tech leaders like Elon Musk and MacKenzie Scott regarding her philanthropic endeavors, emphasizing her commitment to impactful work through the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and Pivotal Ventures.

title: India's 10 bold moves within 72 hours of Pahalgam terror attack
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India has taken decisive actions, including suspending the Indus Waters Treaty and downgrading diplomatic ties with Pakistan. Visas for Pakistani nationals are suspended, and the Attari border crossing is closed. The Indian Navy conducted missile tests, and the Air Force launched a major drill.

title: New record! 43-yo MS Dhoni becomes 4th Indian to...
content: MS Dhoni marked his 400th T20 match, joining an elite group of Indian cricketers. His career, highlighted by a T20 World Cup win and five IPL titles with CSK, showcases his enduring impact. Despite CSK's current struggles, Dhoni's tactical acumen and unwavering fan support continue to define his legendary presence.

title: Sehwag warns 14-yo Suryavanshi: 'Seen many players who get fame ...'
content: Indian cricket legend Virender Sehwag advises young IPL sensation Vaibhav Suryavanshi, cautioning him against complacency. Despite Suryavanshi's impressive debut and lucrative contract, Sehwag stresses the importance of long-term dedication, citing Virat Kohli's enduring career as an example. Sehwag warns that early success doesn't guarantee lasting impact, emphasizing the need for sustained performance and grounded perspective.

title: Elon Musk's DOGE scraps 15 IBM projects, makes company break this practice
content: Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE) has canceled 15 federal contracts with IBM, totaling approximately $100 million. This move, part of DOGE's cost-cutting efforts, has led to a slight decline in IBM's consulting revenue. While IBM downplays the overall impact, the cancellations signal increased scrutiny on federal spending and the challenges for contractors.

title: Indus water pact suspended: How India can punish Pak
content: Following a terrorist attack in Pahalgam, India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty with Pakistan, halting data sharing and potentially allowing for increased water usage from the western rivers. This action marks a significant escalation in tensions, threatening Pakistan's water supply and agriculture, though immediate impact is unlikely due to infrastructure limitations.

title: Sanders slides out of NFL draft's opening round
content: shedeur Sanders was seen as one of the biggest wild cards entering the first round of the draft . he was not picked during the draft's opening round and now waits for his fate to be decided . Sanders admitted he didn't expect to go undrafted Thursday but appeared upbeat .

title: Why Jags went all-in on Travis Hunter at the NFL draft: Will he play both sides of the ball?
content: the Jacksonville Jaguars knew early in the pre-NFL draft process that they wanted Travis Hunter . but he didn't think they'd be able to pull it off, knowing he'd have to trade up from no. 5 overall . he called the Cleveland Browns several weeks ago to see if they could work out a deal .

title: Western Conference playoffs: Thunder on verge of completing sweep vs. Grizzlies
content: the 2024-25 NBA playoffs are in full swing, and our insiders have you covered for every game in the march to the finals . on friday, the no. 1 seed Oklahoma City Thunder completed a comeback to go up 3-0 in the series against the No. 8 seed Memphis Grizzlies . the first playoff game at the Intuit Dome in Inglewood saw the no no. 4 seed Denver Nuggets take a 2-1 lead after the teams split the first two matchup

title: Pahalgam attack: Kashmiri families open hearts & homes to tourists
content: Following the terror attack in Pahalgam, scared tourists found refuge in the homes of Kashmiris, who opened their doors and hearts. These acts of kindness transcended fear, with families like the Maliks offering shelter and refusing payment, prioritizing the safety of tourists over business.

title: Top US scientist of Indian-origin quits after DOGE hatchet slashes science
content: Sethuraman Panchanathan, the Indian-origin Director of the National Science Foundation, resigned amid alleged pressure from the Trump administration to cut the NSF's budget and staff. Frustration over potential budget cuts and conflicts with DEI priorities seemingly led to his departure. Panchanathan emphasized the importance of maintaining US scientific dominance and collaboration with Indian institutions.

title: Pakistan airspace closure: IndiGo to suspend Tashkent & Almaty flights
content: IndiGo is suspending Delhi-Tashkent and Delhi-Almaty flights until at least May 7, 2025, due to the continued closure of Pakistan's airspace for Indian carriers, forcing longer routes. Air India flights to the West may require refueling stops depending on wind conditions and aircraft load. The closure impacts approximately 50 IndiGo international routes, potentially increasing airfares by 30-40%.

title: Trump says Xi called him after China claimed no tariff talks going on
content: President Trump claimed that Chinese President Xi Jinping called him amidst a tense tariff battle where neither country seems willing to concede. ​"Will you call President Xi if he doesn’t call you?" Trump was asked. 'No,' he replied. 'Has he called you yet?' he was asked. The answer was positive. 'When did he call you?' Trump was asked. "He's called. And I don't think that's a sign of weakness on his behalf," Trump said.

title: Dhoni not sure about Chepauk pitch, says 'old red soil wicket was good'
content: MS Dhoni expressed concerns about the MA Chidambaram Stadium pitch, preferring the old red soil surface from before 2010. Pat Cummins chose to bowl first due to the dry surface and potential dew, a decision Dhoni also favoured. CSK made changes, bringing in Dewald Brevis and Deepak Hooda, as both teams aimed to improve their standing after recent setbacks.

title: Why Western media loves to call terrorists 'gunmen'
content: When 26 people were methodically executed in Kashmir’s Pahalgam valley — identified by name, religion, and in some cases, their inability to recite Islamic prayers — the global media did what it does best: looked away, chose its words carefully, and reached for the comforting vocabulary of denial. Not terrorism. Not jihad. Just “gunmen,” “militants,” and the ever-useful “tensions.” Because in the moral economy of modern newsrooms, the value of a life — and the weight of a headline — depends on who the victims are, and who the killers pray to.

title: WWE SmackDown preview, streaming details: Full match card, highlights
content: SmackDown after WrestleMania 41 will feature Undisputed Champion John Cena and Cody Rhodes. The Street Profits, Motor City Machine Guns, and DIY will battle in a TLC match for the WWE Tag Team Titles. A mysterious wrestler reveal is also scheduled, possibly Aleister Black. The event emanates live from Fort Worth, Texas, setting the stage for Backlash.

title: 'Crimea will stay with Russia,' says Trump in new pressure tactic on Ukraine
content: Donald Trump stated Crimea would remain with Russia. He suggested Volodymyr Zelenskyy should make concessions. Trump accused Zelenskyy of prolonging the war. He also criticized Vladimir Putin for strikes on Kyiv. Recent Russian attacks on Ukrainian cities have intensified. Western leaders accuse Putin of stalling negotiations. Zelenskyy mentioned Ukraine accepted a ceasefire proposal earlier.

title: Honeymoon couples caught in terror crosshairs — 26 yrs apart
content: Gurgaon residents Rachna and Himanshi share a tragic connection, both losing their young husbands to terrorism shortly after their weddings. Rachna's husband, Rupin Katyal, died in the 1999 IC-814 hijacking, while Himanshi's husband, Lt Vinay Narwal, was killed in the recent Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Who is Saikat Chakrabarti? Indian-origin man challenging Nancy Pelosi
content: Saikat Chakrabarti, ex-aide to Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez, will contest against Nancy Pelosi in 2026. He aims for California's 11th Congressional District. Chakrabarti said he respects Pelosi's service but seeks change. He believes the Democratic Party needs fresh ideas. Chakrabarti co-founded Justice Democrats. He aided Ocasio-Cortez's 2018 win. He faced criticism for social media posts. He also drew flak for a T-shirt choice.

title: SRK's move from Mannat leaves vendors worried, Shatrughan reacts to attack: Top 5 news
content: Shah Rukh Khan's absence from Mannat impacts local vendors, while Shatrughan Sinha questions religious emphasis after a terrorist attack. A dancer from Riteish Deshmukh's film tragically died, and Rakesh Roshan's financial sacrifices for Hrithik's debut are revealed. Amidst controversy following the Pahalgam attack, Fawad Khan and Vaani Kapoor's film faces removal from YouTube India, sparking widespread reactions and condolences.

title: Siddharth Sagar reacts to Kapil Sharma not inviting him for his show
content: Siddharth Sagar, known for his comedy, discussed his time on The Kapil Sharma Show, clarifying he never felt threatened by Kapil Sharma or Krushna Abhishek. He shot for the show for eight months before it moved to Netflix, and wasn't upset about not being asked to continue. Siddharth now prioritizes his peace of mind above all else in his career.

title: Why Annabel Elliot, Queen Camilla’s sister, refuses to curtsy her
content: Annabel Elliot, Queen Camilla's sister, admits she still finds it hard to curtsy to her, even after 20 years of Camilla's royal life. Despite relaxed royal customs, curtsying remains common, especially for insiders like Elliot. While she may skip the formality, Elliot's support for Camilla is steadfast, serving as her emotional anchor through recent challenges.

title: 'Valid, lawful exercise': What Centre told SC on Waqf row in 10 points
content: The Centre defended the Waqf Amendment Act in the Supreme Court, asserting its alignment with established practices and valid legislative power. The government refuted claims of violating fundamental religious freedoms, emphasizing inclusiveness with non-Muslim representation in Waqf bodies.

title: 'He changes the game': Pollock calls Rohit’s revival the 'coolest' resurgence
content: Mumbai Indians are making a strong comeback in IPL 2025, securing four consecutive wins and climbing into the top four, fueled by Rohit Sharma's resurgence. After a slow start, Rohit has found his form, notching back-to-back half-centuries, which is his first time since 2016. His performance is boosting the team's chances as they aim to solidify their playoff spot.

title: 'Stand united & defeat terrorism': Rahul visits Pahalgam, meets victims
content: Following the deadly terrorist attack in Pahalgam, Rahul Gandhi met with Jammu and Kashmir CM Omar Abdullah and visited victims in Srinagar, emphasizing the need for national unity against divisive forces. He assured full support from the Congress party to both state and central governments. Gandhi also attended an all-party meeting, condemning the attack and backing government measures against terrorism.

title: 'I'm too small a person to even speak about it': DK in awe of 'champ' Kohli
content: Virat Kohli's stellar form continues as he scored his fifth half-century in IPL 2025, leading Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a crucial 11-run victory against Rajasthan Royals. Kohli's impressive 70 off 42 balls propelled RCB to 205/5, which their bowlers defended successfully. Dinesh Karthik praised Kohli's hunger and adaptability, highlighting his reflection on past performances.

title: Pahalgam attack: Don't worry, stay strong, techie told wife in last words
content: In a tragic incident, Bengaluru techie Bharath Bhushan was killed in a terrorist attack, as narrated by his wife Sujatha. Before being shot, Bharath comforted his family, urging them to stay strong. The terrorist questioned their happiness amidst suffering, then fatally shot Bharath after learning his name.

title: BJP leader Raja Iqbal Singh is new Delhi mayor
content: Raja Iqbal Singh of the BJP has been elected as the new Mayor of Delhi, securing 133 out of 142 votes after the AAP withdrew from the race, alleging BJP-engineered defections. The BJP's strength in the MCD has increased since 2022, further bolstered by the inclusion of BJP MLAs as members. AAP leaders have accused the BJP of manipulating the MCD election process since 2022.

title: Why stock market fell today: BSE Sensex ends 589 points down
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, crashed sharply in trade on Friday before recovering partially to close in red. While BSE Sensex dipped over 1,000 points intraday, Nifty50 went below 24,000.

title: After cycling to France, Serbia's students run to Brussels to stir EU attention
content: Serbian students, already known for cycling to France, have begun a 2,000-kilometer run to Brussels to highlight corruption and demand the rule of law in Serbia. Starting from Novi Sad, over 20 students are participating in this relay-style marathon, aiming to draw the EU's attention to their struggle against President Aleksandar Vucic's government.

title: California’s GDP hits $4.1 trillion in 2024; surpasses that of Japan
content: California's GDP surpassed Japan's in 2024, reaching $4.1 trillion, driven by its thriving tech industry and property market. Governor Newsom cautioned that President Trump's tariff policies threaten this economic growth, leading to a lawsuit challenging the tariffs' legality. California, along with other states, argues these tariffs harm businesses and residents, while the White House dismisses the challenge.

title: RBI’s gold buying spree continues with 2nd highest purchase in 7 years
content: The Reserve Bank of India significantly increased its gold reserves by 57.5 tonnes in FY25 amidst global financial instability and rising gold prices. This acquisition, the second largest since 2017, aligns with a global trend of central banks bolstering gold holdings.

title: Pahalgam attack: 'Removed bindis, chanted Allahu Akbar but our husbands still shot'
content: In a tragic incident, Kaustubh Gunbote and Santosh Jagdale were killed by terrorists in Pahalgam, leaving their families and community in grief. Sangita Gunbote recounted the horrifying moments, including their desperate attempt to appear Muslim to avoid being targeted.

title: Court refuses to issue notice to Sonia, Rahul in National Herald case
content: A Delhi court has deferred issuing notices to Sonia and Rahul Gandhi in the National Herald case, directing the Enforcement Directorate to rectify defects and provide more relevant documents. This development follows the ED's April 9 chargesheet, which alleges money laundering involving Rs 5,000 crore. The matter has been scheduled for hearing on May 2.

title: 'We will make them pay if ... ': Pakistan issues threat to India amid Pahalgam attack
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, India responded firmly, prompting Pakistan to issue threats against any "misadventure." India summoned Pakistan's diplomat, declared military diplomats persona non grata, and suspended the Indus Water Treaty and SAARC Visa Exemption Scheme. Pakistan's airspace was closed for Indian airlines.

title: Expert's picks, best bets: Can Machado Garry elude Prates' hard strikes?
content: welterweight contenders Ian Machado Garry and Carlos Prates will clash to determine who moves closer to a title shot at UFC Fight Night on sunday . the fight follows the first loss of his career against Shavkat Rakhmonov in December .

title: Cotton reduced to ashes as major fire breaks out in godown in Bidar
content: Karnataka Today Your daily dose of news highlights from the world of cinema and streaming . today's Cache Your download of the top 5 technology stories of the day . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science .

title: Hundreds Of Tourists Stranded In North Sikkim Due To Landslides Rescued
content: Hundreds of tourists stranded in Chungthang in Mangan district of north Sikkim following landslides were rescued on Friday, officials said.

title: A Decade Of Impact: Dettol Banega Swasth India's Journey To A Healthier Nation
content: For over ten years, the 'Dettol Banega Swasth India' campaign, a partnership between Reckitt and NDTV, has been a prominent force in promoting public health across the nation

title: 'Trying To Cause Communal Unrest': Karnataka Muslims Protest J&K Attack
content: A large group of Muslims protested in Karnataka's Tumkur and highlighted that the terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir, in which 26 people were killed, was an attempt at creating communal unrest in the country.

title: "Angels Sent By God": Tourists Saved By Ponywallah, Locals During J&K Terror Attack
content: A ponywallah who laid down his life trying to save visitors to his homeland, a guide who rescued a family of 11 and countless locals are among those who added another dimension to Kashmir's hospitality when terror struck Pahalgam on a calm Tuesday.

title: Heartwarming Video Of Woman Offering Water To Thirsty Monkey Viral
content: Ask anyone about their experience with monkeys, and they will tell you it wasn't pleasant. All we have heard or known about the creature is that they snatch food items, jump from one tree to another and occasionally even screech and howl at humans.

title: Ex-ISRO Chief Dr K Kasturirangan, The Man Behind India's 1st Moon Mission, Dies At 84
content: Former ISRO chief, Dr K Kasturirangan, the man behind India's maiden mission to the moon, Chandrayaan-1, died in Bengaluru at 84.

title: "J&K Terrorists Claim To Be Muslims, Their Act Un-Islamic": Imam Bukhari
content: The terrorists of the Pahalgam attack claim to be Muslims but have acted in a manner that is utterly "un-Islamic", Shahi Imam of historic Jama Masjid Syed Ahmed Bukhari said in his address during Friday prayers.

title: IMF Reaches Agreement With Sri Lanka On $344 Million Loan Payout
content: The International Monetary Fund announced Friday it had reached agreement on a loan program review with Sri Lanka which will make around $344 million available to support the country's economic reforms.

title: "Sad To See People Attacking My Brothers, Sisters From Kashmir": Rahul Gandhi
content: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi on Friday said the terror attack in Jammu & Kashmir's Pahalgam was carried out with an intent to "divide society" and urged the nation to stand united "to fight this nasty action" and defeat terrorism.

title: President Murmu, Kiren Rijiju Leaves For Vatican To Attend Pope's Funeral
content: President Droupadi Murmu and Union Minister of Parliamentary Affairs Kiren Rijiju have departed for Vatican City to attend Pope Francis's state funeral.

title: Bihar Police Arrests Alleged Mastermind Behind NEET 2024 Paper Leak
content: The Economic Offences Unit (EOU) of Bihar Police has arrested Sanjeev Kumar Singh, the alleged mastermind behind the NEET (UG)-2024 paper leak case, from the state capital, officials said on Friday.

title: Huge Crowds Pack Vatican To Catch Last Glimpse Of Pope Ahead Of Funeral
content: Tens of thousands of people flocked to the Vatican Friday for a last glimpse of Pope Francis's open coffin, as world leaders and other guests began arriving for his funeral.

title: 96% Of Prisoners Pass UP Board's Class 12 Examination
content: In an impressive result, 91 out of 94 prisoners who appeared for the Uttar Pradesh Board of Secondary Education's Class 12 examination from different jails across the state have passed the examination.

title: Sister Genevieve, French Nun Who Broke Protocol To See Pope's Body
content: Images of Sister Genevieve's slight frame, standing in solemn prayer just feet from Pope Francis's body, were beamed around the world.

title: How Suspending Indus Waters Treaty Hurts Pakistan, Ex Top Official Explains
content: India can use many options that can affect Pakistan while the Indus Waters Treaty is in abeyance, the former head of the Central Water Commission told NDTV today.

title: NBA playoff odds: Thunder up 3-0 on Memphis, solidify championship favorite status
content: the top-seeded Oklahoma City Thunder entered the playoffs as favorites to win the NBA championship . the Los Angeles Lakers , Golden State Warriors , LA Clippers and Minnesota Timberwolves have the second-best odds to take home the title . they are up 2-0 in their opening round series with the Orlando Magic .

title: Women voters will support Congress, says Vizianagaram DCC president

title: The time is now: Projecting John Cena's final WWE matches
content: the last time in his career, John Cena has won a title for the 17th time in 2025 . the biggest storyline in WWE will be surrounding his quest to bring the title home with him "forever" we don't know, but wrestling fans love to make predictions and that's what we will do here .

title: Clásico combined XI: Which Barcelona, Real Madrid stars make the cut?
content: the two rivals meet in the copa del Rey final on saturday . the two bitter rivals have some of the world's best players at their disposal . but which players would each manager like to take from their rivals if given the chance?

title: This weekend's spring game previews: Oregon, Penn State and more
content: the big-name diehards will carry on with their spring games Saturday, most notably four Big Ten schools . the Terrapins face a challenging offseason after going 1-8 in the Big Ten last year before losing several key players to the transfe .

title: Large Piece Of Cloth Found In UP Woman's Stomach 2 Years After Surgery
content: In a case of medical negligence, a half-a-metre piece of clothing was left behind inside a woman's stomach during a cesarean operation by doctors of a private hospital in Greater Noida in 2023, her family and health officials said.

title: Provident Fund Body Launches Revamped Form 13 To Speed Up Transfer Claim Process
content: The EPFO has further simplified the process for transfer of PF account on change of jobs by launching a revamped Form 13 software functionality that will speed up the transfer of funds to the new account, according to an official statement.

title: Army Nursing College Website Hacked Days After Pahalgam Terror Attack
content: Days after the terrorist attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam, the website of the Army College of Nursing has been hacked, allegedly by a Pakistan-based hacker group called Team Insane PK.

title: Row Over Canada PM Mark Carney's Call Where Trump Spoke Of "51st State"
content: According to Carney, while Trump did indeed mention this prospect during their March 28 call, he emphasised that the conversation ultimately centered around a nation-to-nation discussion regarding a new security and economic agreement.

title: "Documents Missing In Chargesheet": Court To Probe Agency ED In Herald Case
content: A Delhi court on Friday refused to issue notice to Congress leaders Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi and others in the National Herald money laundering case for now.
